SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.views

Class TextUserInterface

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.views.TextUserInterface
public class TextUserInterface extends Object
A text-based user interface for a food storage system. This class provides the main navigation structure for the user interface, including menus and sub-menus. It also handles the input and output of the user interface, using methods from the InterfaceUtils class.

The init method initializes an empty food storage system and a cookbook. It also sets the current date of the application to the current date of the system.

The start method starts the application, allowing the user to navigate through the different menus and sub-menus.

Since:
0.1
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • TextUserInterface

      public TextUserInterface()

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the text user interface application, by creating a new food storage, cookbook, and current date.

      If an error occurs during initialization, the method passes the error message to the stopByError method, which is responsible for stopping the application and printing the error message..

    • start

      public void start()
      Start the text user interface application.

      If an error occurs during the start process, the method passes the error message to the stopByError method, which is responsible for stopping the application and printing the error message.

    • stopByError

      private void stopByError(String errorMessage)
      Stops the application by printing the provided error message and exiting the application smoothly.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - the error message to print

    • handleMainMenu

      private void handleMainMenu()
      Handles the main menu of the application. This method prompts the user to select a menu option and then calls the appropriate method based on the selected option.
      See Also:
